SENT.plain: The World Health Organization (WHO) assigns myelodysplastic syndrome (MDS) to RA/RCMD/RARS/RSCM/5q- syndrome, if medullary blasts are <5% and peripheral blast (PB) count < or =1%
In 1103 patients with these diagnoses, we analysed survival and risk of AML evolution depending on the presence of PB
Median survival in the group with 1% PB (n=74) was significantly lower as compared to those without PB (20 versus 47 months, p<0.00005)
Cumulative risk of AML was significantly higher in patients showing PB (p<0.00005)
Median survival of patients with PB was not different from that of RAEB I
We therefore propose to consider patients with PB, regardless of medullary blast, as RAEB I
